Free Meals from School Nutrition Services
for All Children (18 and Under)

a.title: TCS COVID Feeding Sites, Community
a.span: Free Meals in the Community for School-Age Children

div.p: See below for more information and daily updates on the Coronavirus Response by Transylvania County Schools and our community partners.

div.div: Faced with the difficult task of ensuring consistency statewide, the NC State Board of Education released a temporary grading policy for all grades K-12. Find details and a link to the complete policy, and notes about educational television, plus teacher and cafeteria staff recognition.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 19—Grading Policy

div.div: On April 24, 2020, the governor and state education leaders announced that all K-12 schools in North Carolina will be closed to the end of the school year. We know there are many questions, and we will provide further updates as information becomes available.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 18—Buildings Are Closed

div.div: The Board of Education meeting for April 6 is broadcast online. Read the update for a link to view a live stream. Meals will be served through Thursday, April 9, and resume April 20 after Spring Break. Supplemental food is being sent home on a specified day for each area this week. Read for details to prepare for a delivery of extra food.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 17 - April 6, 2020

h3.span: We have a plan. It's already in motion.

p.a: Transylvania County Schools Pandemic Plan - Emergency Planning
p.span: describes actions for Transylvania County Schools to take directly and in conjunction with partner agencies to mitigate and prepare for any outbreak, and when needed, to activate response and recovery plans.

div.h4: If cases of coronavirus disease occur in our area, what will happen next?
div.p:
On March 22, 2020, the first confirmed case of COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease) was reported in our area. In all that follows, we continue to rely on Transylvania Public Health to report any new cases, and we will engage in the same interagency cooperation that marks any threat response in our area. We will partner with county public health and public safety, emergency management, law enforcement, and any other agencies assisting in the response.
There are scenarios for using school system resources as part of a community-wide response and recovery to an outbreak. We remain constantly aware that schools play a central role during events that engage the whole community.
Depending on the nature of any threat and response, we remain confident that strong partnerships, built during periods of planning and preparation, will help us deal effectively with any incident.
div.h4: What can parents do proactively to protect their child’s health?
div.p: As noted above, during cold and flu season, by far the most important thing families can do is to model and teach good hygiene with hand-washing, coughing, and sneezing, and to take common sense precautions to protect against the spread of respiratory illness. It is always important to wash or sanitize hands after using the bathroom or touching door handles, shared computers, etc.

td.span: Transylvania County Schools aims to help children, parents, and guardians remain informed about the current state of the coronavirus outbreak. With good information, and by planning to make good choices about hygiene and behavior, we can limit the spread of infection for our sake, and for those around us.

div.h4: What is your question about Transylvania County Schools operations during this time?

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: Merriweather, serif; font-size: 13.3333px;
p.span: Please see the infectious disease/pandemic plan posted on this page for general information about our preparation for dealing with COVID-19 in our community. If you have a specific question about school planning and operations and cannot find your answer here or by contacting your school, fill out our form and send us your question.

h4.style: font-size: 18px; font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

h3.style: font-size: 24px; font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); text-align: center;

a.title: TCS coronavirus question page, operations and planning

h3.a: Submit a question for Transylvania County Schools

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: Merriweather, serif;
p.span: We cannot give medical advice, and for clear, current, and accurate information we strongly recommend everyone to use the websites above for local, state, and national health officials.

span.br: The first, best line of defense is for everyone to practice social distancing and good hygiene—limit your family’s movements, cough and sneeze into your elbow or tissues, wash your hands frequently, and most importantly stay home when you have any flu-like symptoms. Call your chosen health care professional (including urgent or emergency care) before traveling to seek a diagnosis or treatment.
